## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on AI-assisted development for Hyperfy, particularly using LLMs to generate code for interactive 3D environments. Users experimented with different approaches to "vibe coding" - using AI to generate code for games and interactive elements. Several members shared examples of AI-generated platform games, stadiums, and obstacle courses. 

Key technical points included:
- Comparing browser-based AI prompting versus code-specific tools like Cursor/Claude, with the observation that browser-based prompting is faster for simple tasks
- Discussion of a potential memory leak in certain code implementations
- Performance improvements for shape instancing
- Challenges with AI hallucinating non-existent methods (like player.velocity.y)
- Iterative approach to building complex structures by generating code section by section
- Discussion about detecting mobile devices for responsive UI design
- A bug identified with the control.screen functionality

The conversation revealed a workflow where developers prompt AI models to generate code snippets, then integrate or modify them for Hyperfy environments, with varying degrees of success depending on the model used and approach taken.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How do I access the AI prim builder? (asked by maximus) A: You need to be on the latest dev branch and prompt AI to get code (answered by MetaMike and Valiant)
Q: What is the forward/up jump distance for avatars? (asked by Valiant) A: Jump height is ~1.5m and jump distance while running is around 5m (guessing) (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there a way to detect mobile for resizing UI? (asked by Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz) A: control.screen.width and control.screen.height exist. Will add world.device.isTouch soon (answered by Ashxn)
